properties.name: Eiffel Tower
properties.description: An iconic iron lattice tower built for the 1889 World's Fair, offering panoramic views of Paris from its observation decks.
properties.address: Champ de Mars, 5 Avenue Anatole France, 75007 Paris, France

properties.name: Louvre Museum
properties.description: The world's largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris, home to masterpieces like the Mona Lisa and the Venus de Milo.

properties.name: Musée d'Orsay
properties.description: A museum housed in a Beaux-Arts railway station, showcasing French art from 1848 to 1914, including Impressionist masterpieces.
properties.address: 1 Rue de la Légion d'Honneur, 75007 Paris, France

properties.name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
properties.description: A masterpiece of Gothic architecture famous for its sculptures, stained glass, and bell towers. Currently under restoration.
properties.address: 6 Parvis Notre-Dame - Pl. Jean-Paul II, 75004 Paris, France

properties.name: Sainte-Chapelle
properties.description: A royal chapel built in the 13th century, renowned for its stunning stained-glass windows depicting biblical scenes.

properties.name: Palace of Versailles
properties.description: A lavish royal residence outside Paris, famous for its Hall of Mirrors, gardens, and role in French history.

properties.name: Arc de Triomphe
properties.description: A monumental arch honoring those who fought and died for France in the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars.
properties.address: Place Charles de Gaulle, 75008 Paris, France

properties.name: Panthéon
properties.description: A neoclassical mausoleum housing the remains of distinguished French citizens such as Voltaire, Rousseau, and Marie Curie.

properties.name: Musée Rodin
properties.description: A museum dedicated to the works of French sculptor Auguste Rodin, set in a beautiful mansion with a sculpture garden.

properties.name: Les Invalides
properties.description: A complex containing museums and monuments related to France's military history, including Napoleon Bonaparte’s tomb.

properties.name: Palais Garnier
properties.description: A 19th-century opera house renowned for its opulent architecture and as the inspiration for 'The Phantom of the Opera'.

properties.name: Petit Palais
properties.description: An art museum built for the 1900 Exposition Universelle, housing fine arts collections from the Renaissance to the 20th century.

properties.name: Grand Palais
properties.description: A historic site and exhibition hall known for its glass-domed roof and hosting major art and cultural events.
properties.address: 3 Avenue du Général Eisenhower, 75008 Paris, France

properties.name: Musée de l'Orangerie
properties.description: An art gallery featuring Impressionist and Post-Impressionist paintings, including Monet's famous Water Lilies series.

properties.name: Conciergerie
properties.description: A former royal palace and prison, known for housing Marie Antoinette before her execution during the French Revolution.

properties.name: Place de la Concorde
properties.description: One of Paris's major public squares, famous for its Egyptian obelisk and its role in the French Revolution.
properties.address: Place de la Concorde, 75008 Paris, France

properties.name: Montmartre
properties.description: A historic hilltop district known for its artistic heritage, cobbled streets, and the Basilica of Sacré-Cœur.

properties.name: Sacré-Cœur Basilica
properties.description: A Roman Catholic basilica with a striking white exterior and one of the best panoramic views of Paris.
properties.address: 35 Rue du Chevalier de la Barre, 75018 Paris, France

properties.name: Musée Picasso
properties.description: A museum dedicated to Pablo Picasso's works, housed in the historic Hôtel Salé in the Marais district.

properties.name: Musée Carnavalet
properties.description: A museum dedicated to the history of Paris, located in two historic mansions in the Marais district.

properties.name: Père Lachaise Cemetery
properties.description: The largest cemetery in Paris, final resting place of famous figures like Jim Morrison, Oscar Wilde, and Édith Piaf.

properties.name: Palais Royal
properties.description: A historic palace with beautiful gardens and arcades, once home to royalty and now housing government offices.

properties.name: Pont Alexandre III
properties.description: A Beaux-Arts style bridge, lavishly decorated with lamps and statues, connecting the Champs-Élysées quarter with Invalides.

properties.name: Place des Vosges
properties.description: The oldest planned square in Paris, surrounded by red-brick houses and a favorite spot for locals and tourists.

properties.name: Musée du Quai Branly – Jacques Chirac
properties.description: A museum showcasing indigenous art and cultures from Africa, Asia, Oceania, and the Americas, in a striking modern building.
